str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.
